alert.note: Alert for Baltimore; Carroll; Frederick; Howard; Montgomery (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 22 at 2:02PM EDT until April 22 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Carroll County in north central Maryland... Howard County in central Maryland... Montgomery County in central Maryland... Southeastern Frederick County in north central Maryland... Southwestern Baltimore County in northern Maryland... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 202 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Boyds, or near Germantown, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Columbia, Germantown, Rockville, Bethesda, Gaithersburg, Olney, Pikesville, Westminster, Damascus, Poolesville, Historic Ellicott City, Ellicott City, Aspen Hill, Potomac, North Bethesda, Woodlawn, Randallstown, Montgomery Village, Owings Mills and Eldersburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
